Atorvastatin

Counseling Pearls

  • Stomach upset and diarrhea are common when first starting Atorvastatin. This side effect should go away within a week.
  • Watch for unexplained muscle aches and pains. This can be a symptom of rhabdomyolysis which can progress to a more serious medical condition. Have patients contact their doctor if this occurs.
  • Cholesterol levels take significant time to change. Ensure that patients are taking this medication every day and have them follow up with their doctor in a few months to have their cholesterol checked.
  • Atorvastatin should not be used in pregnancy
  • Avoid drinking more than a liter of grapefruit juice a day, as it will significantly increase atorvastatin concentrations.
     

Typical dosage range is 10 to 80 mg once daily. Time of dosing does not matter.

Side Effects

  • Nausea
  • Diarrhea
  • Muscle Aches
  • Muscle Pain

Description

Atorvastatin is used to lower lipid levels by inhibiting HMG-CoA Reductase. The inhibition of this enzyme reduces the synthesis of cholesterol in the body.

It is primarily metabolized by CYP3A4.
